intro: Notopleura triaxillaris, commonly known as the three-axile notopleura, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant features opposite, elliptical leaves that are often hairy on the underside. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically with three stamens, which is reflected in its scientific name. Notopleura triaxillaris is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
